intro: Cremanthodium lobatum, commonly known as the Sierra lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to dry, high-altitude environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. Cremanthodium lobatum is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
